org.red5.server.api
Interface SharedObject

public interface SharedObject

Serverside access to shared objects. Changes to the shared objects are propagated to all subscribed clients. If you want to modify multiple attributes and notify the clients about all changes at once, you can use code like this:

SharedObject.beginUpdate();
SharedObject.updateAttribute("One", "1");
SharedObject.updateAttribute("Two", "2");
SharedObject.deleteAttribute("Three");
SharedObject.endUpdate();

All changes between "beginUpdate" and "endUpdate" will be sent to the clients using one notification event.

Author:
The Red5 Project (red5@osflash.org), Joachim Bauch (jojo@struktur.de)

Method Detail

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of the shared object.

Returns:
the name of the shared object

getVersion

public int getVersion()
Returns the version of the shared object. The version is incremented automatically on each modification.

Returns:
the version of the shared object

isPersistent

public boolean isPersistent()
Check if the object has been created as persistent shared object by the client.

Returns:
true if the shared object is persistent, false otherwise

getData

public java.util.Map getData()
Return a map containing all attributes of the shared object.
NOTE: modifications to this map are _not_ propagated to the connected clients.

Returns:
a map containing all attributes of the shared object

updateAttribute

public boolean updateAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.Object value)
Add / edit an attribute.

Parameters:
name - the name of the attribute to change
value - the new value of the attribute
Returns:
true if the attribute value has changed, false otherwise

getAttribute

public java.lang.Object getAttribute(java.lang.String name)
Return the value for a given attribute.

Parameters:
name - the name of the attribute to get
Returns:
the attribute value or null if the attribute doesn't exist

deleteAttribute

public boolean deleteAttribute(java.lang.String name)
Remove an attribute from the shared object.

Parameters:
name - the name of the attribute to delete
Returns:
true if the attribute has been found and deleted, false otherwise

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(java.lang.String handler,
                        java.util.List arguments)
Send a message to a handler of the shared object.

Parameters:
handler - the name of the handler to call
arguments - a list of objects that should be passed as arguments to the handler

public void clear()
Delete all attributes of the shared object.

beginUpdate

public void beginUpdate()
Start performing multiple updates to the shared object.

endUpdate

public void endUpdate()
The multiple updates are complete, notify clients about all changes at once.

registerClient

public void registerClient(org.red5.server.context.Client client,
                           int channel)
Register a new client with the channel that should receive updates of the shared object.

Parameters:
client - the client that wants to subscribe to this object
channel - the connection channel of this client

unregisterClient

public void unregisterClient(org.red5.server.context.Client client)
Unregister all channels of a client.

Parameters:
client - the client to unsubscribe from this object

unregisterClient

public void unregisterClient(org.red5.server.context.Client client,
                             int channel)
Unregister one channel of a client.

Parameters:
client - the client to unsubscribe a channel from this object
channel - the connection channel to unsubscribe
